page.title: 05 GUILDFORD FARM
page.content: Guildford Farm dates back to 1490. It is situated south of Fishbourne and 5 km East of Newport in a peaceful area of country-side. It belongs to Mr.C.A.E Biggs who is a retired farmer. The farm originally covered 98 acres but 60 acres were sold to neighbouring farms. The remaining acres are mostly let for grazing. Maximum livestock here was formerly 12 heifers, 8 calves, 44 milking cows and 650 chickens and a couple of cockerels. {Produce:}80% of all eggs were graded and sold to local shops and grocers. The eggs did better than any other farm activity. Milk was sold and was quite profitable. Mr & Mrs Biggs now run a basketry and cane furniture shop, which is very successful. Furniture is bought from Somerset and all over the world.
